Install ThingsBoard Gateway from Source¶

Generate an SSH Key¶

  1. Generate ssh key on pi using ssh-keygen

  2. cd .ssh - Visit the directory where your SSH key can now be found

  3. cat id_rsa.pub - Display the public key. Copy it.

  4. Go to the GitHub and log in with the account associated with the gateway repository

  5. Navigate to Settings > SSH and GPG keys > New SSH Key

  6. Paste the public key in the Key box

Running ThingsBoard Gateway¶

  1. cd ~ - Move to the home directory of the gateway

  2. Follow the steps laid out in the ThingsBoard Gateway Source Installation Instructions

    • Step 2 - Instead perform git clone git@github.com:drexelwireless/thingsboard-gateway.git

    • Step 4 - Be sure to use sudo python3 setup.py install instead

  3. In order to run your gateway from the source, you need to add thingsboard-gateway.service in /etc/systemd/system directory

    • cd /etc/systemd/system - Move to the directory the service file will live in

    • cp ~/setup_files/thingsboard-gateway.service . - Copy the service file to the directory you just moved to

  4. sudo systemctl daemon-reload -

  5. sudo systemctl start thingsboard-gateway.service - Start ThingsBoard Gateway

  6. sudo journalctl -u thingsboard-gateway.service -f - Check the status of ThingsBoard Gateway
